title: pKa for conjugate acid of CH3NH2

content.question:
<math alttext="B aqueous plus H C l aqueous is in equilibrium with H B with a positive 1 charge aqueous plus C l with a negative 1 charge aqueous" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mtext>B(</mtext><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mtext>)</mtext><mo>+</mo><mtext>HCl(</mtext><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mtext>)</mtext><mo>⇄</mo><msup><mrow><mtext>HB</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mtext>(</mtext><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mtext>)</mtext><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mtext>Cl</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup><mtext>(</mtext><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mtext>)</mtext></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

The graph above shows the titration curve for an aqueous solution of a weak base, <math alttext="B " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>B</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, with <math alttext="H C l" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>HCl</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> as the titrant. Based on the graph, which of the following best estimates the <math alttext="p K sub a " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>p</mtext><mi>K</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> of <math alttext="H B with a positive 1 charge " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>HB</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>?

skill.text: 5.D: Identify information presented graphically to solve a problem.
